alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 11:30AM PST until January 29 at 2:01AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... North Fork Stillaguamish River Near Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Flooding continues on the north fork of the Stillaguamish River due to this morning`s heavy rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Stillaguamish River near Arlington. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, the North Fork Stillaguamish River will cause flooding of Oso Loop Road and cause minor riverbank erosion. A stage of 13 feet corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PST Sunday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 13.2 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 11/12/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 545 PM PST.
